As I always fail when using Surt Prefix, I try for MatchesRegExpDecideRule =
this time. 

<newObject name=3D"decide-rules" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.=
deciderules.DecideRuleSequence">
- <map name=3D"rules">
  <newObject name=
=3D"1" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.RejectDecideRule" /> 
- <ne=
wObject name=3D"2" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDe=
cideRule">
  <string name=3D"decision">ACCEPT</string> 
  <string name=3D"r=
egexp">.*cs\.umn\.edu/~?[a-z]*/$</string> 
  </newObject>
- <newObject name=
=3D"3" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.TooManyHopsDecideRule">
  <=
integer name=3D"max-hops">20</integer> 
  </newObject>
- <newObject name=3D=
"5" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.TooManyPathSegmentsDecideRule"=
>
  <integer name=3D"max-path-depth">3</integer> 
  </newObject>
  <newObje=
ct name=3D"6" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.PrerequisiteAcceptDe=
cideRule" /> 
  </map>
  </newObject>
  </newObject>

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com,=
 Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> shichuanwuhan@... wrote:
> > Hi all,
>=
 > 
> >   Suppose I plan to crawl all professors' homepages on the site: ht=
tp://www.cs.umn.edu/people/faculty/index.php 
> > 
> >    To avoid redundan=
t crawling, I set max-hop to 2 and max-path-segment to 15. However, I can o=
nly successfully crawl no more than 5 homepages(in the form of '/~name/') a=
ccording to crawl log. Could anyone tell me why?
> 
> Which 5 do you get?
>=
 
> What's an example of one that you think you should have gotten, but did=
n't?
> 
> Note that a crawl with the default profile, starting with just th=
e seed 
> URI 'http://www.cs.umn.edu/people/faculty/index.php' will only vi=
sit 
> outlink navigational URIs that begin 
> 'http://www.cs.umn.edu/peopl=
e/faculty/'. (Those are the only URIs 
> 'implied' as in-scope by the seed.=
 To get more, you'd have to add more 
> seeds or SURT-prefix scope-directiv=
es.)
> 
> It will not visit pages on 'www-users.cs.umn.edu', or even URIs o=
n 
> 'www.cs.umn.edu' whose path-segment does not begin '/people/faculty/'.=

> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> 
> >    Following is my crawl order:
> > 
> > 2-15=
